title: See Ya- S.R.
body:
Summary- You bump into Steve Rogers at a wedding

Word Count-1887

A/N: Guys I’m sorry this is short and not too good, I wanted something for you guys to read, yes this WILL be a two parter. Enjoy. (WARNING: NOT PROOF READ!!!)

Whoever said going to a wedding was the most fun you’ll ever had, was a liar.

“Y/N!” You cringed at the yell of your name.

“Yeah…?” you quietly said in return, trying to calm the bride who was currently having her third meltdown of the night.

The first was right before the lovely bride walked down the aisle.

“Zoey, you look amazing what are you crying about?” you asked wrapping your arms around her to comfort her. Her poofy hair engulfed your face as you held her. She didn’t say anything, she just let go and held up her bouquet of flowers before she let out another long sob. You raised your eyebrows to question her.

“Eleven.” was all she said still leaving you puzzled. You raised an eyebrow at her.

“There is supposed to be twelve flowers and there’s only eleven.” You scowled when you heard the other bridesmaids snicker. Sure, she was being a little dramatic for just one flower, sure no one would notice, but hell this was her day and you both spent so long making it perfect.

“Okay how far away is a flower shop?” you asked letting out a sigh. You saw her face light up.

“There’s one across the street” she said before someone cut in.

“There is not enough time to go and grab one flower.”

“Zip it Carly and get the makeup girl over here,” was all you said before you ran to your car.

You arrived back just in time and not a moment too late. Carly rolled her eyes but you would do anything for your best friend. It was worth the odd stares in the flower shop due to your overdone dress just to see her glowing as she walked down the aisle. You couldn’t help but let out a few tears as the vows were said. But all good things must come to an end.

The second meltdown was during the pictures.

“Y/N, my dress.” she said through gasps of air. Your eyes went wide at all the possibilities that could be wrong with her dress.

“Zoey what is wrong with your dress?” you asked not wanting to hear the answer. You both spent months hunting for the ‘perfect dress’. Eventually she gave up and decided that nothing would ever live up to everything she wanted..until she had in her words, ‘the most perfect idea.’

“Y/N you could totally make my dress!” she said excitedly. You laughed thinking she was kidding only to realize she was standing there with a straight face. You sighed and buried your face in your hands.

“Okay…fine, but you owe me big time when it’s my turn” you said and jokingly pointed at her to show her you were ‘serious’.

“My dress isn’t poofing out enough like it used too.” she said lifting her head to the sky so the tears wouldn’t run down and ruin her mascara. You could hear the agony in her voice.

“Y/N should hide under your dress and hold it out to poof it up,” you heard Carly say. You glared at her as she laughed in return only to turn around and see Zoey’s face lit up.

“No no no,” was all you replied.

Next thing you knew you were under your best friend’s skirt staring at nothing but white tulle.

‘My wedding dress will be bright blue.’ you thought to yourself after staring at the white fabric for a solid twenty minutes. You weren’t too mad in the end, when it was your turn to take pictures with the bride, Carly was hidden under the mass of fabric. You’ve never looked so happy in a photo.

The rest of the majority of the night was spent laughing and dancing away with your friends. The speeches were your favorite part of the night.

You heard the clinking of glass being hit as a tall man stood up. You had seen him a few times during the rehearsals and such, but he was always busy with work, travelling a lot.

“Hi, uh my name is Steve Rogers, I usually don’t do too much public speaking so this is a little odd.” he said earning a quiet laugh from the crowd attempting to make him feel better.

“When I met Mason,” he said giving the groom a pat on his shoulder.

“I would have never thought I would be his best man at his wedding.We barely talked when we met and hung out at a mutual friend’s place, you guys may not believe this but I’m actually pretty shy. We finally bonded over not understanding things like the internet or 90’s rom-com movies.” he said this time earning a genuine laugh from the guests.

“I won’t take too much time up, I know the maid of honor will need to talk. So i just want to say, I love you like a brother man, and I’m so happy for you and Zoey, best of luck in this marriage.” He finished and began to walk over to pass the mic to you. You couldn’t take your eyes off of him as he approached. You were amazed how he could have such a dominating demeanor, but have such kind and sincere eyes.

‘Note to self, get to know that man’ you thought before you stood up.

“Hi guys,” you said to the crowd before looking at Zoey.

“Zoey, first I want to start off by saying I love you. I could not have asked for a better best friend. From the moment we met, I knew we were going to be friends for a very very long time. Okay, well not when we first met because we were like I don’t know, one years old? Anyways it doesn’t matter, from the moment I could understand the concept of friendship, I knew we were going to be friends forever.” you heard the crowd giggle a little as you looked at Steve who had a hand covering his mouth trying not to laugh.

“Alright I know you guys don’t really want to hear me babble on for too much longer, so I will just say Z, I love you, no offense Mason, but I think I love her more.” You said only semi-joking, he put his hands up in surrender. He already knew he couldn’t replace you.

“So I’m glad you two finally got together at that coffee shop because now look, you guys are married!! Okay, okay, I think I said enough.” you ended your speech and sat back down as the guests clapped for Steve and yourself.

The night droned on as people began to get too drunk to physically dance. Most people ended up sitting in random places of the reception hall. You figured you should go and mingle a little, although it might not be that fun considering the lack of booze in your system. You wanted to be ready for whatever this wedding threw at you so drinking was out of the picture unless uncontrollable laughing was a way to solve a problem.

“Hey stranger,” you said sitting next to the best man.

“Why’re you sitting all alone?” you asked Steve.

“Most people are too drunk to speak, so I figured I wouldn’t try and talk. How about you?”

“Same here,” you replied and sighed.

“Plus, I’ve been running around trying to make sure everything is perfect for Zoey.” you said and sighed.

“Yeah, I saw you under her dress earlier.” he said and chuckled. You could feel your face begin to heat up and turn red.

“Hey you have it easy, I bet Mason doesn’t have meltdowns.” You said in your defense.

“No, no he doesn’t.” Steve smiled at you. You felt the butterflies in your stomach begin to take flight.

“So, how long have you known the groom,” you asked trying to get to know him better.

“About six years, give or take.” You were shocked by the reponse.

“Geez, how come I haven’t met you sooner? I’ve known Mason almost as long, four years I think.”

“I work. A lot. Plus, I travel a lot.” You nodded to show you were listening to him when ‘Rude’ by Magic! began to play.

“I used to love this song,” you both said in unison. A blush crept on your cheeks.

“So, Ms. Y/L/N, how would you like to-”

“Y/N!!”

‘No please, not now’ you thought to yourself. Sure enough, a drunk, crying bride came your way dragging her equally as drunk bridesmaid with her.

“Carly, you had one job! Don’t allow her to get too wasted!” you yelled.

“You see, I tried” she said and hiccuped

“But the bartender was cute and I needed an excuse to talk to him” She turned around giving finger guns towards the bartender while shooting him a wink. You rolled your eyes as the man just turned the other way.

“Okay, Zoey why are you yelling my name?”

“I need help.” You gave her a face saying ‘tell me more’…she didn’t get the hint to keep talking.

“Need help with what?”

“A lot of things. Follow me,” she giddily said before you turned to Steve with an apologetic expression. He gave you a small smile before you walked away.

Finally, after helping her pee, cleaning up all of her flowers, and finding her veil, you went back to find the best man. Unfortunately, by the time you were done helping your best friend, everyone else besides Carly and the bartender had left.

You sighed and decided it wasn’t meant to be anyways before taking off your heels and walking to your car.

Three days later you were finally back to work. As you walked into the coffee shop the familiar scent hit your nose and made you grin.

“I’ll have two iced coffees and one chai latte,” you read off your phone.

“Got it,” was all the lady at the counter said before motioning you to pay.

“Y/N!” You grabbed the drink carrier full of beverages. Your phone began to vibrate in your pocket.

“Hello,”
“Crap that’s hot!”

“I am so sorry,” you said attempting to grab a few napkins before seeing the person in front of you.

“Hey.” You sighed seeing Steve in front of you before attempting to help clean the coffee from his shirt.

‘Damn this feels nice’ you said as you pat his chest.

“Long time no see,” he sarcastically said.

“Yeah, sorry about walking away the other night, Zoey really needed me.”

“It’s fine, I get it.”

“So um,” you suddenly found it awkward to speak.

“I guess I should go reorder the drinks and call my boss back-”
“Would you like to go get dinner with me this Friday,” he interrupted.

“Yeah, yeah I would like that a lot.” You smiled at him and then snapped back into reality.

“Although I really should call my boss back, he gets mad pretty easily.”
“Tell me about it,” he said and then rolled his eyes. You quickly wrote your number on a napkin and handed it to him.

“I’ll see you Friday.” You turned around and got back in line.

“Yeah, see ya.” he repeated to himself and walked out the door, a big dopey grin on both of your faces.

“Hi, uh my name is Steve Rogers, I usually don’t do too much public speaking so this is a little odd.” he said earning a quiet laugh from the crowd attempting to make him feel better.

“When I met Mason,” he said giving the groom a pat on his shoulder.

“I would have never thought I would be his best man at his wedding.We barely talked when we met and hung out at a mutual friend’s place, you guys may not believe this but I’m actually pretty shy. We finally bonded over not understanding things like the internet or 90’s rom-com movies.” he said this time earning a genuine laugh from the guests.

“I won’t take too much time up, I know the maid of honor will need to talk. So i just want to say, I love you like a brother man, and I’m so happy for you and Zoey, best of luck in this marriage.” He finished and began to walk over to pass the mic to you. You couldn’t take your eyes off of him as he approached. You were amazed how he could have such a dominating demeanor, but have such kind and sincere eyes.

‘Note to self, get to know that man’ you thought before you stood up.

“Hi guys,” you said to the crowd before looking at Zoey.

“Zoey, first I want to start off by saying I love you. I could not have asked for a better best friend. From the moment we met, I knew we were going to be friends for a very very long time. Okay, well not when we first met because we were like I don’t know, one years old? Anyways it doesn’t matter, from the moment I could understand the concept of friendship, I knew we were going to be friends forever.” you heard the crowd giggle a little as you looked at Steve who had a hand covering his mouth trying not to laugh.

“Alright I know you guys don’t really want to hear me babble on for too much longer, so I will just say Z, I love you, no offense Mason, but I think I love her more.” You said only semi-joking, he put his hands up in surrender. He already knew he couldn’t replace you.

“So I’m glad you two finally got together at that coffee shop because now look, you guys are married!! Okay, okay, I think I said enough.” you ended your speech and sat back down as the guests clapped for Steve and yourself.

The night droned on as people began to get too drunk to physically dance. Most people ended up sitting in random places of the reception hall. You figured you should go and mingle a little, although it might not be that fun considering the lack of booze in your system. You wanted to be ready for whatever this wedding threw at you so drinking was out of the picture unless uncontrollable laughing was a way to solve a problem.

“Hey stranger,” you said sitting next to the best man.

“Why’re you sitting all alone?” you asked Steve.

“Most people are too drunk to speak, so I figured I wouldn’t try and talk. How about you?”

“Same here,” you replied and sighed.

“Plus, I’ve been running around trying to make sure everything is perfect for Zoey.” you said and sighed.

“Yeah, I saw you under her dress earlier.” he said and chuckled. You could feel your face begin to heat up and turn red.

“Hey you have it easy, I bet Mason doesn’t have meltdowns.” You said in your defense.

“No, no he doesn’t.” Steve smiled at you. You felt the butterflies in your stomach begin to take flight.

“So, how long have you known the groom,” you asked trying to get to know him better.

“About six years, give or take.” You were shocked by the reponse.

“Geez, how come I haven’t met you sooner? I’ve known Mason almost as long, four years I think.”

“I work. A lot. Plus, I travel a lot.” You nodded to show you were listening to him when ‘Rude’ by Magic! began to play.

“I used to love this song,” you both said in unison. A blush crept on your cheeks.

“So, Ms. Y/L/N, how would you like to-”

“Y/N!!”

‘No please, not now’ you thought to yourself. Sure enough, a drunk, crying bride came your way dragging her equally as drunk bridesmaid with her.

“Carly, you had one job! Don’t allow her to get too wasted!” you yelled.

“You see, I tried” she said and hiccuped

“But the bartender was cute and I needed an excuse to talk to him” She turned around giving finger guns towards the bartender while shooting him a wink. You rolled your eyes as the man just turned the other way.

“Okay, Zoey why are you yelling my name?”

“I need help.” You gave her a face saying ‘tell me more’…she didn’t get the hint to keep talking.

“Need help with what?”

“A lot of things. Follow me,” she giddily said before you turned to Steve with an apologetic expression. He gave you a small smile before you walked away.

Finally, after helping her pee, cleaning up all of her flowers, and finding her veil, you went back to find the best man. Unfortunately, by the time you were done helping your best friend, everyone else besides Carly and the bartender had left.

You sighed and decided it wasn’t meant to be anyways before taking off your heels and walking to your car.

Three days later you were finally back to work. As you walked into the coffee shop the familiar scent hit your nose and made you grin.

“I’ll have two iced coffees and one chai latte,” you read off your phone.

“Got it,” was all the lady at the counter said before motioning you to pay.

“Y/N!” You grabbed the drink carrier full of beverages. Your phone began to vibrate in your pocket.

“Hello,”
“Crap that’s hot!”

“I am so sorry,” you said attempting to grab a few napkins before seeing the person in front of you.

“Hey.” You sighed seeing Steve in front of you before attempting to help clean the coffee from his shirt.

‘Damn this feels nice’ you said as you pat his chest.

“Long time no see,” he sarcastically said.

“Yeah, sorry about walking away the other night, Zoey really needed me.”

“It’s fine, I get it.”

“So um,” you suddenly found it awkward to speak.

“I guess I should go reorder the drinks and call my boss back-”
“Would you like to go get dinner with me this Friday,” he interrupted.

“Yeah, yeah I would like that a lot.” You smiled at him and then snapped back into reality.

“Although I really should call my boss back, he gets mad pretty easily.”
“Tell me about it,” he said and then rolled his eyes. You quickly wrote your number on a napkin and handed it to him.

“I’ll see you Friday.” You turned around and got back in line.

“Yeah, see ya.” he repeated to himself and walked out the door, a big dopey grin on both of your faces.
trail.content:
Summary- You bump into Steve Rogers at a wedding

Word Count-1887

A/N: Guys I’m sorry this is short and not too good, I wanted something for you guys to read, yes this WILL be a two parter. Enjoy. (WARNING: NOT PROOF READ!!!)

Whoever said going to a wedding was the most fun you’ll ever had, was a liar.

“Y/N!” You cringed at the yell of your name.

“Yeah…?” you quietly said in return, trying to calm the bride who was currently having her third meltdown of the night.

The first was right before the lovely bride walked down the aisle.

“Zoey, you look amazing what are you crying about?” you asked wrapping your arms around her to comfort her. Her poofy hair engulfed your face as you held her. She didn’t say anything, she just let go and held up her bouquet of flowers before she let out another long sob. You raised your eyebrows to question her.

“Eleven.” was all she said still leaving you puzzled. You raised an eyebrow at her.

“There is supposed to be twelve flowers and there’s only eleven.” You scowled when you heard the other bridesmaids snicker. Sure, she was being a little dramatic for just one flower, sure no one would notice, but hell this was her day and you both spent so long making it perfect.

“Okay how far away is a flower shop?” you asked letting out a sigh. You saw her face light up.

“There’s one across the street” she said before someone cut in.

“There is not enough time to go and grab one flower.”

“Zip it Carly and get the makeup girl over here,” was all you said before you ran to your car.

You arrived back just in time and not a moment too late. Carly rolled her eyes but you would do anything for your best friend. It was worth the odd stares in the flower shop due to your overdone dress just to see her glowing as she walked down the aisle. You couldn’t help but let out a few tears as the vows were said. But all good things must come to an end.

The second meltdown was during the pictures.

“Y/N, my dress.” she said through gasps of air. Your eyes went wide at all the possibilities that could be wrong with her dress.

“Zoey what is wrong with your dress?” you asked not wanting to hear the answer. You both spent months hunting for the ‘perfect dress’. Eventually she gave up and decided that nothing would ever live up to everything she wanted..until she had in her words, ‘the most perfect idea.’

“Y/N you could totally make my dress!” she said excitedly. You laughed thinking she was kidding only to realize she was standing there with a straight face. You sighed and buried your face in your hands.

“Okay…fine, but you owe me big time when it’s my turn” you said and jokingly pointed at her to show her you were ‘serious’.

“My dress isn’t poofing out enough like it used too.” she said lifting her head to the sky so the tears wouldn’t run down and ruin her mascara. You could hear the agony in her voice.

“Y/N should hide under your dress and hold it out to poof it up,” you heard Carly say. You glared at her as she laughed in return only to turn around and see Zoey’s face lit up.

“No no no,” was all you replied.

Next thing you knew you were under your best friend’s skirt staring at nothing but white tulle.

‘My wedding dress will be bright blue.’ you thought to yourself after staring at the white fabric for a solid twenty minutes. You weren’t too mad in the end, when it was your turn to take pictures with the bride, Carly was hidden under the mass of fabric. You’ve never looked so happy in a photo.

The rest of the majority of the night was spent laughing and dancing away with your friends. The speeches were your favorite part of the night.

You heard the clinking of glass being hit as a tall man stood up. You had seen him a few times during the rehearsals and such, but he was always busy with work, travelling a lot.

“Hi, uh my name is Steve Rogers, I usually don’t do too much public speaking so this is a little odd.” he said earning a quiet laugh from the crowd attempting to make him feel better.

“When I met Mason,” he said giving the groom a pat on his shoulder.

“I would have never thought I would be his best man at his wedding.We barely talked when we met and hung out at a mutual friend’s place, you guys may not believe this but I’m actually pretty shy. We finally bonded over not understanding things like the internet or 90’s rom-com movies.” he said this time earning a genuine laugh from the guests.

“I won’t take too much time up, I know the maid of honor will need to talk. So i just want to say, I love you like a brother man, and I’m so happy for you and Zoey, best of luck in this marriage.” He finished and began to walk over to pass the mic to you. You couldn’t take your eyes off of him as he approached. You were amazed how he could have such a dominating demeanor, but have such kind and sincere eyes.

‘Note to self, get to know that man’ you thought before you stood up.

“Hi guys,” you said to the crowd before looking at Zoey.

“Zoey, first I want to start off by saying I love you. I could not have asked for a better best friend. From the moment we met, I knew we were going to be friends for a very very long time. Okay, well not when we first met because we were like I don’t know, one years old? Anyways it doesn’t matter, from the moment I could understand the concept of friendship, I knew we were going to be friends forever.” you heard the crowd giggle a little as you looked at Steve who had a hand covering his mouth trying not to laugh.

“Alright I know you guys don’t really want to hear me babble on for too much longer, so I will just say Z, I love you, no offense Mason, but I think I love her more.” You said only semi-joking, he put his hands up in surrender. He already knew he couldn’t replace you.

“So I’m glad you two finally got together at that coffee shop because now look, you guys are married!! Okay, okay, I think I said enough.” you ended your speech and sat back down as the guests clapped for Steve and yourself.

The night droned on as people began to get too drunk to physically dance. Most people ended up sitting in random places of the reception hall. You figured you should go and mingle a little, although it might not be that fun considering the lack of booze in your system. You wanted to be ready for whatever this wedding threw at you so drinking was out of the picture unless uncontrollable laughing was a way to solve a problem.

“Hey stranger,” you said sitting next to the best man.

“Why’re you sitting all alone?” you asked Steve.

“Most people are too drunk to speak, so I figured I wouldn’t try and talk. How about you?”

“Same here,” you replied and sighed.

“Plus, I’ve been running around trying to make sure everything is perfect for Zoey.” you said and sighed.

“Yeah, I saw you under her dress earlier.” he said and chuckled. You could feel your face begin to heat up and turn red.

“Hey you have it easy, I bet Mason doesn’t have meltdowns.” You said in your defense.

“No, no he doesn’t.” Steve smiled at you. You felt the butterflies in your stomach begin to take flight.

“So, how long have you known the groom,” you asked trying to get to know him better.

“About six years, give or take.” You were shocked by the reponse.

“Geez, how come I haven’t met you sooner? I’ve known Mason almost as long, four years I think.”

“I work. A lot. Plus, I travel a lot.” You nodded to show you were listening to him when ‘Rude’ by Magic! began to play.

“I used to love this song,” you both said in unison. A blush crept on your cheeks.

“So, Ms. Y/L/N, how would you like to-”

“Y/N!!”

‘No please, not now’ you thought to yourself. Sure enough, a drunk, crying bride came your way dragging her equally as drunk bridesmaid with her.

“Carly, you had one job! Don’t allow her to get too wasted!” you yelled.

“You see, I tried” she said and hiccuped

“But the bartender was cute and I needed an excuse to talk to him” She turned around giving finger guns towards the bartender while shooting him a wink. You rolled your eyes as the man just turned the other way.

“Okay, Zoey why are you yelling my name?”

“I need help.” You gave her a face saying ‘tell me more’…she didn’t get the hint to keep talking.

“Need help with what?”

“A lot of things. Follow me,” she giddily said before you turned to Steve with an apologetic expression. He gave you a small smile before you walked away.

Finally, after helping her pee, cleaning up all of her flowers, and finding her veil, you went back to find the best man. Unfortunately, by the time you were done helping your best friend, everyone else besides Carly and the bartender had left.

You sighed and decided it wasn’t meant to be anyways before taking off your heels and walking to your car.

Three days later you were finally back to work. As you walked into the coffee shop the familiar scent hit your nose and made you grin.

“I’ll have two iced coffees and one chai latte,” you read off your phone.

“Got it,” was all the lady at the counter said before motioning you to pay.

“Y/N!” You grabbed the drink carrier full of beverages. Your phone began to vibrate in your pocket.

“Hello,”
“Crap that’s hot!”

“I am so sorry,” you said attempting to grab a few napkins before seeing the person in front of you.

“Hey.” You sighed seeing Steve in front of you before attempting to help clean the coffee from his shirt.

‘Damn this feels nice’ you said as you pat his chest.

“Long time no see,” he sarcastically said.

“Yeah, sorry about walking away the other night, Zoey really needed me.”

“It’s fine, I get it.”

“So um,” you suddenly found it awkward to speak.

“I guess I should go reorder the drinks and call my boss back-”
“Would you like to go get dinner with me this Friday,” he interrupted.

“Yeah, yeah I would like that a lot.” You smiled at him and then snapped back into reality.

“Although I really should call my boss back, he gets mad pretty easily.”
“Tell me about it,” he said and then rolled his eyes. You quickly wrote your number on a napkin and handed it to him.

“I’ll see you Friday.” You turned around and got back in line.

“Yeah, see ya.” he repeated to himself and walked out the door, a big dopey grin on both of your faces.
